Package science.aist.machinelearning.core

Interface Algorithm<ST,​PT>

  • Type Parameters:
    ST - Solution Genome Type
    PT - Problem Genome Type
    All Superinterfaces:
    Configurable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAlgorithm
    public interface Algorithm<ST,​PT>
extends Configurable
    Interface for machine learning algorithm that solves a problem It is based on the concept of Problem and Solution spaces, where one or more Problem Genomes PT can be transformed into one or more Solution Genomes GT
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Oliver Krauss

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Analytics getAnalytics()
      gets the current analytics tool for the algorithm If an analytics tool is set the algorithm will automatically log its parameters and all of its steps to the tool for scientific analysis.
      void setAnalytics​(Analytics analytics)
      sets an analytics tool for the algorithm.
      Solution<ST,​PT> solve​(Problem<PT> problem)
      Solves a problem and returns best found mapping
      Solution<ST,​PT> solve​(Problem<PT> problem, Solution<ST,​PT> bestSolution)
      Solves a problem and returns best found mapping.

      • Methods inherited from interface science.aist.machinelearning.core.Configurable

        getOptions, setOption, setOptions

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        Solution<ST,​PT> solve​(Problem<PT> problem)
        Solves a problem and returns best found mapping
        Parameters:
        problem - to be solved
        Returns:
        best mapping that was found with alg

      • solve

        Solution<ST,​PT> solve​(Problem<PT> problem,
                            Solution<ST,​PT> bestSolution)
        Solves a problem and returns best found mapping. Starts search with the given mapping.
        Parameters:
        problem - problem to be solved
        bestSolution - start search with this mapping
        Returns:
        best mapping that was found with alg

      • getAnalytics

        Analytics getAnalytics()
        gets the current analytics tool for the algorithm If an analytics tool is set the algorithm will automatically log its parameters and all of its steps to the tool for scientific analysis.
        Returns:
        analytics or null

      • setAnalytics

        void setAnalytics​(Analytics analytics)
        sets an analytics tool for the algorithm.
        Parameters:
        analytics - the analytics
